free_txt: Of authors; note added in proof.
An extensive X-ray analysis of all individual crystal
slabs of sample was done after experiment because of
the risk of damaging the surface layers. It showed that
one of thin-sample crystals and two of thick-sample
were incorrectly mounted- their c-axis and 90 deg
Correcting for these misoriented crystals the
As a consequence the A2 values in tables must be
Difference between thick and thin sample is probably
related to difference in quality of surface layers.
JC-80-10 diffused-junction silicon detectors, each of
Electron pulse width 230 nsec, repetition rate of
Beam cross-sectional area 5x5 cm**2 close to cryostat.
Flight path - length 9.95+-0.05 m , at 20deg to
Series of collimators in flight tube.
spectra from each detector pair were checked regularly
with 100-channel analyzer. Alpha-peaks had FWHM of
Double peaks were not almost unobservable in
Fission-fragment counts rates from thick and thin
samples were measured with detectors at 0 and 90 deg to
crystal c-axes as function of neutron energy at various
temperature. Two main series of measurements, of 9 and
10 runs each, with and without Cd filter.
Sodium filter was kept in the beam to give background
point at its 2.8 keV resonance. In addition,further run
were made at low and high temperature with composite
filter of Mn (336 eV resonance), Co (132 eV),
Ta (39 and 4.3 eV) and In (1.46 eV), as well as Na, to
determine variation of background with energy.
Only Cd-filter data was used except for 0.29 eV
resonance, since their background corrections are much
Ratios N(0deg)/N(90deg) for many resonances and energy
regions were obtained for thick and thin samples.
Weighted mean ratios over the resonances 1.177+-0.004
and 1.307+-0.007 for thick and thin samples
Details of method of crystal preparation.
Uranil-rubidium nitrate crystals to cut slabs of about
2 mm thick parallel to natural face corresponded to
hexagonal planes, with which the crystal c-axis makes
Crystals were attached to each side of copper plate
with low- temperature varnish GE 7031. One side of
plate held 21 crystals containing 27.7 mg U-235 over
total surface of 20.6 cm**2; other side - 15 crystals
of 9.6 mg U-235 over total area of 13.0 cm**2; average
thicknesses of 1.34 and 0.74 mg/cm**2 of U-235.
He-3-He-4 dilution refrigerator kept sample at
temperature of about 0.1 K . Speer resistor of
of cerium magnesium nitrate crystal, was used as
thermometer; attached to bottom of copper sample plate.
Temperature of copper sample plate changed from 0.092
Temperature was estimated as 0.12+-0.01 K and
0.14+-0.01 K for the with-Cd and without-Cd runs,
